alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 25 at 7:24PM EDT until March 26 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW AND MIXED PRECIPITATION CONTINUES THROUGH TONIGHT... .Snow will overspread the advisory area from this afternoon through the evening from west to east. The snow will be heaviest tonight and may mix with sleet at times. Much of the accumulating snowfall is expected to be finished Sunday morning. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow mixed with sleet at times. Total snow accumulations between 3 and 5 inches, sleet accumulations around one quarter of an inch. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...Until 8 AM EDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
